comments: d is called a (1+phi)-divisor of a number n with prime factorization n = Product p(i)^r(i) if d|n and d = Product p(i)^s(i), where s(i)=0 or GCD(s(i),r(i))=1.a(n) is odd iff n is a 3-full number (cf. A036966).
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
prog: (Haskell)a061389 = product . map ((+ 1) . a000010 . fromIntegral) . a124010_row-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Mar 13 2012
